Crimes.Legal_Issue: Did Bodine's actions constitute a material misrepresentation under Section 40(1)(a) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act?
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Bodine's conduct undermined credibility by creating false impression
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Physical evidence (transfer of belongings), conduct at border
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Whether the misrepresentation could induce an error in the administration of the Act
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Transfer of belongings to reduce visible goods after prior refusal
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: Section 40(1)(a) of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Crimes.Application_Error: Misleading border officials about volume of goods brought into Canada
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Objective assessment of whether conduct constitutes material misrepresentation
Crimes.Application_Factor: Timing of re-entry attempt and concealment of belongings
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 40(1)(a)
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the Board's finding of misrepresentation was reasonable
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Attempt to re-enter with fewer visible belongings after prior refusal
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Reliance on observable conduct rather than documentary evidence
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness: No indication of procedural unfairness raised
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Conduct intended to mislead border officials
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Judicial review application challenging inadmissibility finding
Crimes.Omission_Type: Concealment of material facts through physical omission
